Exercises 1,2,3,4,7

__*1.Produce forecasts for the following series using whichever of NAIVE(y), SNAIVE(y) or RW(y ~ drift()) is more appropriate in each case:*__

__*1.a Australian Population (global_economy)*__

```{r}
library(mlbench)
data(Glass)

dfGlass <- Glass %>% 
  mutate(Type = as.numeric(Type))

str(dfGlass)

```

```{r}


w <- EHSummarize_SingleColumn_Boxplots(dfGlass)
x <- EHSummarize_SingleColumn_Histograms(dfGlass)

grid.arrange(grobs=w[1:10], ncols=3)
grid.arrange(grobs=x[1:10], ncols=3)

a <- EHExplore_Multicollinearity(dfGlass, threshold=.6, printHighest = TRUE)

```
